intro: Hieracium wilczekianum subsp. pseudosilsinum, commonly known as the false silsilen hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is considered a low-growing species with a compact habit, often forming dense colonies in its native range.
